timeline.message:
Support gRPC Scala using ScalaPB

Motivation:

As a part of better interop with other JVM languages(#1078),
it would be nice if Armeria Grpc server and client support [ScalaPB](https://scalapb.github.io/).

Notifications:

- Rename the original `GrpcMessageMashaller` to `GrpcMessageMashallingHandler`.
- Introduce a new interface `GrpcMessageMashaller`. A user can customize
 `GrpcMessageMashaller` by setting it to GrpcServerBuilder or GrpcClientOptions.
  I'm not sure this approach is the right direction. 🧐
- Add ScalaPBMessageMashaller.
  Note, It is hard to support releasing an artifact with multiple Scala versions in Gradle.
  Do we need to move this code to Armeria `contrib`?

Result:

You can now use the gRPC server/client stubs generated by ScalaPB

timeline.bodyText:
This makes me think GRPC_JSON_MARSHALLER and JSON_MARSHALLER_CUSTOMIZER are not orthogonal. Should we merge these two options into one, e.g. GRPC_JSON_MARSHALLER_FACTORY (Function<Class<?>, GrpcJsonMarshaller>)? The default value of the new option could be something like:
clientType -> GrpcJsonMarshaller.of(clientType)
where GrpcJsonMarshaller.of() calls something like new DefaultJsonMarshaller(GrpcJsonUtil.jsonMarshaller(stubMethods(clientType)).
If a user wants to customize the marshaller, the user could specify an alternative factory like this:
clientType -> GrpcJsonMarshaller.builder(clientType)
                                ...
                                .build()
For ScalaPB and others, it could be _ -> ScalaPBJsonMarshaller().
What do you think, @ikhoon and @anuraaga ?
timeline.author: trustin

replies.bodyText:
That was my most considering part - JSON marshaller and JSON marshaller customizer. I want to merge the extension points into one.
GRPC_JSON_MARSHALLER_FACTORY looks good to me. 👍
